result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Elizabeth H.
Trial Judge - Br 11 to schedule further proceedings.
Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Kristin K. Shimabuku appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State requests bench warrant, GRANTED
Bail/bond hearing at 10-05-2015 02:30 pm; defn's notice undeliverable
From BMP. Failure to comply with bond. Request for BBH.

- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Elizabeth H.
Referral to Bail Monitoring

Information was filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defn waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of not guilty; motions due in 20 days; Defn. refered to BMP.  Bail amended to $500 signature bond. Bail continued.  All other conditions remain the same.
Copy given defendant, reading waived.
Branch 11

Defn. did not qualify for state public defender.  Defn advised he was an attorney and was licensed in the State of Virginia but his license is currently suspended. Defn. advised he would be representing himself for the preliminary hearing.  Ct. had colloquy w/defn. & found defn. was competent to represent himself and waived his right to counsel for this hearing only.  Ct. adjourned for state to attempt to loacte their witness.  Court reconvened.  Reporter: Linda Flakne - Atty Gleason appeared and stated he spoke with defn. and defn. agreed to be represented by him for the preliminary hearing.  Defn confirmed w/Ct. that Atty Gleason would represent him for this hearing.  Jimmy Milton, MAPD PO duly sworn and testified.  Direct exam by Atty Hilton. Stipulation as to identification of Defendant.  Cross exam by Atty Gleason.  Witness excused.  State moved for bindover/no argument by Atty Gleason.  Ct. found probable cause that a felony was committed by defn. and ordered bind over.
and Notice of DNA and Witness List (plaintiff's)

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Elizabeth H.

Trial judge - Br 11

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Tim Helmberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
